title: Real Madrid vs . Al Ahly live updates : Start time , streaming , lineups , prediction and team news
body_text:
How Real Madrid beat Al Ahly 4-1 to reach the Club World Cup final
Summary
Real Madrid are through to the Club World Cup final after overcoming Egyptian side Al Ahly 4-1 at the Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat, Morocco.
Vinicius Junior, Federico Valverde, Rodrygo and Sergio Arribas were all on the scoresheet despite a spirited performance from Al Ahly, who also found the back of the net after an Ali Maaloul spot-kick.
Ancelotti's side will return to the Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium on Saturday as they look to lift a record fifth Club World Cup.
They will face Saudi side Al-Hilal, who upset Flamengo 3-2 in their semi-final on Tuesday.
In a high-octane first half, both sides carved openings as they aimed to break the deadlock. The majority of the action occurred on Real's left flank, as the Brazilian duo of Vinicius Jr and Rodrygo consistently combined to threaten Al Ahly's defence, while being complemented by the overlapping runs of Eduardo Camavinga.
Similarly, Hussein El Shahat was Al Ahly's main outlet going forward, twice testing the gloves of Real goalkeeper Andriy Lunin.
Yet, it was the La Liga side that took the lead just before the break through Vinicius Jr. Al Ahly failed to clear, allowing the 22-year-old to break through the lines before confidently chipping the ball over a hapless Mohammed El Shenawy.
Shortly after half-time, Real doubled their advantage when Federico Valverde tapped in a rebound after Rodrygo's effort was parried away by El Shenawy.
Al Ahly found a lifeline, however, when they were awarded a penalty at the hour mark. El Shahat was brought down in the area by Camavinga, and Tunisia international Maaloul duly converted his spot-kick.
Al Ahly pressed for an equaliser but, with five minutes remaining, Real were also handed a penalty when Vinicius Jr was fouled. Luka Modric stepped up but saw his effort saved. Real shortly restored their two-goal advantage in stoppage time when Rodrygo finished a lovely passing move.
Substitute Sergio Arribas added a fourth against the resilient Al Ahly in the dying embers of the game after slotting home from a Real free-kick.
(Photo: Getty Images)
Good night!
Thank you for joining us for tonight's coverage.
FULL TIME: Al Ahly 1-4 Real Madrid
After an uncomfortable period in the second half, Real showed their quality late on with a flurry of goals.
It ended up being a comfortable victory for the La Liga side but the scoreline might be slightly unfair for Al Ahly, who put up a spirited performance.
GOAL! Real Madrid extend lead
90+6 Al Ahly 1-4 Real Madrid
Sergio Arribas, who has only been on the pitch for a matter of seconds after replacing Vinicius Jr, scores Real's fourth of the night!
A Real free-kick isn't cleared and it lands at the feet of Arribas in the box, who controls before drilling a lovely effort into the bottom corner.
GOAL! Rodrygo scores for Real
90+3 Al Ahly 1-2 Real Madrid
An outstanding team goal!
After composed build-up from Real, the substitute Ceballos plays the ball into Rodrygo in the box.
Rodrygo returns it to Ceballos, who dribbles and drags away Al Ahly defenders with him, before a sumptuous back-heel into the path of the winger.
Rodrygo, who only has the keeper to beat, takes his time before lifting it over El Shenawy.
And that surely is game, set and match.
Eight minutes added on!
The fourth official's board goes up to indicate that we'll have eight minutes of stoppage time.
Plenty of drama left in this one!
Chance for Real!
The La Liga side continue to threaten.
This time its Modric, who threads a pass in the path of Rodrygo.
The Brazil international shifts it on to his left inside the area but leans back, which results in his effort flying well over the bar.
SAVED! El Shenawy saves
87' Al Ahly 1-2 Real Madrid
And Al Ahly are still in this!
Modric fails to convert his spot-kick as El Shenawy makes a strong save to parry it away to safety.
It was a tame effort from the Croatian international, who shakes his head in disappointment.
Penalty for Real!
After a lengthy check, the referee has pointed to the spot!
Luka Modric to take...
Penalty appeal from Real
Ancelotti's side want a penalty after Vinicius Jr goes down in the box and they're all up in arms.
The referee has gone to his monitor to check...
Nervy for Real
Al Ahly's substitute Taher has been a livewire on the right wing, and Real appear tense in possession as they are aiming to take the sting out of the game by slowing down play when in possession.
Ten minutes to go...
Real Madrid make substitution
76' Al Ahly 1-2 Real Madrid
Ancelotti makes his first change of the night, with Kroos replaced by the in-form Dani Ceballos.
Al Ahly make substitution
74' Al Ahly 1-2 Real Madrid
It's becoming a slightly scrappier affair, with some visibly tired legs.
And Al Ahly make their third substitution of the night, with El Shahat — who has been exceptional tonight — replaced by Mohamed Taher.
Chance for Al Ahly!
68' Al Ahly 1-2 Real Madrid
What an opportunity!
Real Madrid are stretched and a ball is drilled into the box, with Afsha having to take it first-time.
His effort flashes over the crossbar, however, as he puts his head in his hands — he knows that should have been the equaliser.
An intriguing affair
That goal has sparked Al Ahly into life, and they're back to pressing and harassing Real's players.
The temperature among the supporters in the stadium has also turned up a notch, with some signs of nervous moments for Real as they are struggling to maintain possession.
GOAL! Al Ahly score
64' Al Ahly 1-2 Real Madrid
Al Ahly are back in it!
Maaloul tucks his spot-kick away with composure, slotting to his left as he sends Lunin in the opposite direction.
Penalty for Al Ahly!
63' Al Ahly 0-2 Real Madrid
El Shahat has been Al Ahly's dangerman tonight.
On this occasion, he cuts inside in the box and is brought down by Camavinga.
The referee points straight to the spot to give Al Ahly a potential lifeline...
Corner for Al AHly
59' Al Ahly 0-2 Real Madrid
We're approaching the hour mark, and the Egyptian side need to find their way back into this tie.
They manage to win a corner, which is cleared away by Real. The ball bounces towards Hany outside the area, who attempts an effort but he's unable to connect cleanly and it is collected by Lunin.
Real appeal for a penalty
Vinicius Jr bamboozles Metwally down the left flank.
The winger then races towards goal and is brought down by Metwally, with the referee pointing for a corner.
There is a VAR check for a possible penalty, however, but the referee's initial decision stands.
Real also waste their eventual corner.
Real in their groove
53' Al Ahly 0-2 Real Madrid
That second goal looks to have taken the wind out of Al Ahly's sails.
Real are knocking the ball around with ease as we're already the 'Ole' territory every time a pass is made.
Tchouameni then tries another long-range piledriver that stings the palms of El Shenawy.
